name: lifesaver
content:
lifesaver noun [C]
(HELP)
Add to word list
Add to word list
someone or something that gives you a lot of help when you are in a very difficult situation: Sarah had been something of a lifesaver these past few days. When you're stuck in traffic, a mobile phone's an absolute life-saver. Steven described his new job as a life saver for him and his wife Fiona - who has recently given birth to twins.
something that helps save lives: Some doctors believe the test is a lifesaver. Your quick response in an emergency could be a life-saver for your child. Early detection of breast cancer is a life saver.

lifesaver noun [C]
(WATER)
Australian English a person on a beach or at a swimming pool whose job is to make certain that the swimmers are safe and save them if they are in danger: Nearly all lifesavers are required to cover up with hats, shirts and sunscreen while on the job. The life-savers spent the next 40 minutes surrounded by the dolphins before they could safely swim back to shore. If you are not a good swimmer ask a life saver for the best spots to swim and where the rips and currents are.
